Package com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller

Class MHealthAtlasAppInfoQueryController

java.lang.Object
com.mhealthatlas.apps.controller.MHealthAtlasAppInfoQueryController
@Controller
@RequestMapping("/apps")
public class MHealthAtlasAppInfoQueryController
extends java.lang.Object
MHealthAtlasAppInfoQueryController is the class containing all API endpoints for quering applications in the mHealthAtlas system.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Integer defaultPage
    Default page is 0
    private java.lang.Integer defaultPageSize
    Default page size is Integer.MAX_VALUE; this default should be changed before going in production
    private AppPlatform defaultPlatform
    Default platform is AppPlatform.AndroidAndIos, favour if available the android informations otherwise use the ios informations
    private java.lang.String defaultSortColumn
    Default sort column is id
    private java.lang.String defaultSortDir
    Default sort direction is ascending

  • Method Details

    • getMHealthAtlasAppsShortInfo

      @GetMapping @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MHealthAtlasAppShortInfosDto> getMHealthAtlasAppsShortInfo​(@RequestParam(value="platform",required=false) AppPlatform platform, @RequestParam(value="page",required=false) java.lang.Integer page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=false) java.lang.Integer size, @RequestParam(value="sortDir",required=false) java.lang.String sortDir, @RequestParam(value="sort",required=false) java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the application service database for mHealthAtlas applications.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps

      The amount of returned applications can be restricted using the size parameter. In conjunction with the page parameter applications can be skipped. The amount of skipped applications are calculated with the formula: page * size. Additionally the matching application version can be sorted using the sort parameter to specify the sort column and the sortDir parameter to specify the sort direction.

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      platform - the preferred application platform; default is defaultPlatform; optional query parameter
      page - the starting page number of the returned android applications; default is defaultPage; optional query parameter
      size - the page size; default is defaultPageSize; optional query parameter
      sortDir - the sort direction ("ASC", "DESC"); default is defaultSortDir; optional query parameter
      sort - the sort column; default is defaultSortColumn; optional query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched mHealthAtlas applications;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR response if the sort column does not exists;

    • getMHealthAtlasAppsInfo

      @GetMapping("/info") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MHealthAtlasAppInfosDto> getMHealthAtlasAppsInfo​(@RequestParam(value="search-query",required=false) java.lang.String searchQuery, @RequestParam(value="platform",required=false) AppPlatform platform, @RequestParam(value="page",required=false) java.lang.Integer page, @RequestParam(value="size",required=false) java.lang.Integer size, @RequestParam(value="sortDir",required=false) java.lang.String sortDir, @RequestParam(value="sort",required=false) java.lang.String sort)
      Queries the application service database for detailed mHealthAtlas applications.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/info

      Optionally the methods takes a searchQuery as a parameter. Then the method queries all applications that match the given search string. If the platform parameter is AndroidAndIos or IosAndAndroid then the android and ios application musst match the given search string. If only an application exists only on one plattform then only these application must match the search string.
      If the platform parameter is Android or Ios then the the given application for the specified platform musst match the given search string.

      The amount of returned applications can be restricted using the size parameter. In conjunction with the page parameter applications can be skipped. The amount of skipped applications are calculated with the formula: page * size. Additionally the matching application version can be sorted using the sort parameter to specify the sort column and the sortDir parameter to specify the sort direction.

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      searchQuery - the search string; default is null; optional query parameter
      platform - the preferred application platform; default is defaultPlatform; optional query parameter
      page - the starting page number of the returned android applications; default is defaultPage; optional query parameter
      size - the page size; default is defaultPageSize; optional query parameter
      sortDir - the sort direction ("ASC", "DESC"); default is defaultSortDir; optional query parameter
      sort - the sort column; default is defaultSortColumn; optional query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched mHealthAtlas applications;
      500 INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR response if the sort column does not exists; 404 NOT_FOUND response if no application matched the given searchQuery;

    • getMHealthAtlasAppDetailInfo

      @GetMapping("/{id}") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MHealthAtlasAppDetailInfoDto> getMHealthAtlasAppDetailInfo​(@PathVariable java.lang.Long id, @RequestParam(value="platform",required=false) AppPlatform platform)
      Queries the application service database by the specified mHealthAtlas application id.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/{id}

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      id - the mHealthAtlas application id; not null; request path parameter
      platform - the preferred application platform; default is defaultPlatform; optional query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched mHealthAtlas applications, if the specified mHealthAtlas application exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • getAppVersionIdsByTaxonomyCLassIds

      @GetMapping("/{appType}/ids") @ResponseStatus(OK) @PreAuthorize("permitAll()") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<java.lang.Long>> getAppVersionIdsByTaxonomyCLassIds​(@PathVariable AppType appType, @RequestParam(value="taxonomyClassIds",required=true) java.util.List<java.lang.Long> taxonomyClassIds)
      Queries the application service database by the specified application version taxonomy classes.

      The method can be invoked with an HTTP GET request calling /apps/{appType}/ids

      All mHealthAtlas users are permitted to call this API endpoint.

      Parameters:
      appType - the application type ("Android", "Ios", "Private"); not null; request path parameter
      taxonomyClassIds - the List of taxonomy class ids; not null; required query parameter
      Returns:
      200 OK response containing the matched application versions, if application versions with all given taxonomy class ids exists;
      404 NOT_FOUND response otherwise;

    • toMHealthAtlasAppShortInfosDto

      private MHealthAtlasAppShortInfosDto toMHealthAtlasAppShortInfosDto​(java.util.List<MHealthAtlasApp> mhealthatlasApps, AppPlatform platform, java.lang.Long skipped, java.lang.Long returned, java.lang.Long total)
      Transforms each mHealthAtlas application to an MHealthAtlasAppShortInfoDto using the MHealthAtlasAppExtensions.toMHealthAtlasAppShortInfoDto method. The transformed mHealthAtlas applications are wrapped in an MHealthAtlasAppInfosDto.
      Parameters:
      mhealthatlasApps - the List of mHealthAtlas application
      platform - the preferred application platform
      skipped - the skipped mHealthAtlas application
      returned - the returned mHealthAtlas application number
      total - the total number of mHealthAtlas application in the database
      Returns:
      MHealthAtlasAppShortInfosDto, a mHealthAtlas application short infos wrapper object
      See Also:
      MHealthAtlasAppExtensions.toMHealthAtlasAppShortInfoDto(MHealthAtlasApp, AppPlatform)

    • toMHealthAtlasAppInfosDto

      private MHealthAtlasAppInfosDto toMHealthAtlasAppInfosDto​(java.util.List<MHealthAtlasApp> mhealthatlasApps, AppPlatform platform, long skipped, java.lang.Long returned, java.lang.Long total)
      Transforms each mHealthAtlas application to an MHealthAtlasAppInfoDto using the MHealthAtlasAppExtensions.toMHealthAtlasAppInfoDto method. The transformed mHealthAtlas applications are wrapped in an MHealthAtlasAppInfoDto.
      Parameters:
      mhealthatlasApps - the List of mHealthAtlas application
      platform - the preferred application platform
      skipped - the skipped mHealthAtlas application
      returned - the returned mHealthAtlas application number
      total - the total number of mHealthAtlas application in the database
      Returns:
      MHealthAtlasAppInfoDto, a mHealthAtlas application infos wrapper object
      See Also:
      MHealthAtlasAppExtensions.toMHealthAtlasAppInfoDto(MHealthAtlasApp, AppPlatform)
